subject: Business
title: The Von Restorff Effect: Standing Out
description: A quick, practical guide to The Von Restorff Effect: Standing Out.

hook.text: In a list of black words, the one red word is the one you remember. That's the Von Restorff effect.

buildup.text: Our brains prioritize things that are different from their surroundings. Novelty captures attention.

discovery.text: Apple's white earbuds stood out in a sea of black ones. The difference was the marketing.

twist.text: If everyone tries to stand out the same way, nobody stands out. Differentiation is relative, not absolute.

climax.text: The key: study your category's visual norms, then break exactly one. Not everything â€” just one thing.

punchline.text: Be the one thing that doesn't match. That's what gets remembered.

quiz.question: What is the Von Restorff effect?
options: Items that stand out from their surroundings are better remembered
People prefer the most expensive item in a group
Repetition improves memory for all items equally
